channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for IN
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for IN

item.title: Report E-2023110242
item.description:
Report E-2023110242

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-21T18:13:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-02
  • City: INDIANAPOLIS
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On November 2, 2023, two (2) 5-gallon pails of UN1993 were crushed in transit and released approximately ten (10) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Indiana Spill Response (ISR) to remediate the impacted site. ISR personnel collected two (2) damaged 5-gallon pails for disposal. Crews then deployed granular absorbent to the impacted trailer floor, concrete and nearby trench drain and worked them in utilizing hand tools. All UN1993 impacted material was collected and containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum for transport and disposal.

item.title: Report X-2023101282
item.description:
Report X-2023101282

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-17T18:14:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-13
  • City: KOKOMO
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Driver took the package to the Customer inspected the package, seen that it was damage and refused it. Driver brought it back we placed it in a salvage drum. DescribePack: Looks like the lid was not put on correctly, the threads were not lined up which caused it to leak. DurationRel: 16 and MitigateEffect: Driver placed the package inside a bag in his truck and brought it back to the station

item.title: Report I-2023060175
item.description:
Report I-2023060175

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-18T00:32:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-04
  • City: WESTFIELD
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: CORRIGAN OIL CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Fuel transport vehicle E/B SR 32 (Main st) approaching the traffic circle at Poplar st. Transport was loaded with 8500 gallons of 87 octane gasoline. Electronic Log showed driver slowed to 19 mph as he was approaching circle. I was advised that a witness had seen the trailer strike the curb on the passenger side as it entered the circle. Driver then starts to accelerate as he was going through the circle to 22 mph. Driver stated that as he went around the circle the tractor and trailer started to roll. Driver stated that tractor went far enough over that he saw the asphalt roadway out the passenger side window. Driver stated that trailer king pin suddenly broke away from trailer and tractor suddenly slammed back down on its wheels. The driver was wearing his seatbelt. The trailer went down on it's passenger side, rolled, and landed back on it's driver side. Compartment #4 had a tear in the outer shell and was leaking from that damage. Product was also coming out of the interstitial holes located on the top of the trailer. Westfield Fire arrived on scene, set up initial containment, and plugged the leaks. Our environmental contractor (3 Pro environmental services) was on scene at 15:56 hrs and also assisted with containment, scene clean up, and remediation. 729 gallons of gasoline was spilled. 3 catch basins in area were affected but we're full of debris so they didn't drain away from scene. All catch basins sucked out and cleaned. 3 PRO Environmental contractor has been working with Indiana Dept. of Environmental Management Dwayne Caldwell (Incident #107392) since arrival on scene on date of incident. Also coordinating with Hamilton County Emergency Management and Westfield Stormwater and associated public services.
